member.name: T:C1.C1Flash.Base.FActionStartDrag
member.summary: An action that starts dragging a movie clip.
member.remarks: 1. pops value TARGET off stack 2. pops LOCKCENTER off stack 3. pops CONSTRAIN 4. if CONSTRAIN is non-zero: - pops y2 - pops x2 - pops y1 - pops x1 5. starts dragging of movie clip identified by TARGET 6. if LOCKCENTER is non-zero, the center of clip is locked to the mouse position, otherwise clip moves relative to starting mouse position 7. if CONSTRAIN, draged clip is constrained coordinates x1, y1, x2, y2

member.name: T:C1.C1Flash.C1FlashCanvas
member.summary: C1FlashCanvas is one of the main classes in the C1Flash library. This class is inherited from the class.

remarks.para: A canvas is a drawing surface similar to that of the .NET Graphics class. All the graphical elements after calling the drawing methods will be rendered to a single frame SWF document.

The coordinate system used by C1FlashCanvas is based on logical pixel, with the origin located at the top left corner of the page. You can retrieve the size of the canvas using the Width and Height property.

member.name: T:C1.C1Flash.FPage
member.summary: A wrapper class that provides the drawing methods and properties similar to those used in the .NET Graphics class.

remarks.para: All the drawing method calls will be translated to the SWF file format and applied to an individual flash frame. If you know how to use the graphics class, you already know how to output graphical elements to a flash frame.
You cannot create an instance of FPage directly.

member.name: M:C1.C1Flash.FPage.DrawLine(System.Drawing.Pen,System.Drawing.Point,System.Drawing.Point)
member.summary: Draws a line connecting the two points specified by coordinate pairs.
member.param: object that determines the color, width of the line.
structure that represents the first point to connect.
structure that represents the second point to connect.

remarks.para: The pen parameter is a regular object, which defines the width, color, and style of the line. The system pens (e.g. Pens.Black, Pens.Red, etc) have a width of one point. If you want to draw thinner or thicker lines, you have to create new objects.

SWF file format has no native support for dashed or dotted line styles. A dashed line can be simulated by breaking up the path into a series of short lines. All lines in SWF file format have rounded joins and end-caps.

member.name: M:C1.C1Flash.FPage.DrawPolygon(System.Drawing.Pen,System.Drawing.Point[])
member.summary: Draws a polygon defined by an array of structures.
member.param: object that determines the color, width of the polygon.
Array of structures that represent the vertices of the polygon.

remarks.para: The polygon is drawn by joining each pair of points with a line, and connecting the last point in the array with the first one.
The DrawPolygon method draws the outline of the polygon. To fill the polygon, use the method.

member.name: M:C1.C1Flash.FPage.DrawBeziers(System.Drawing.Pen,System.Drawing.Point[])
member.summary: Draws a series of Bzier splines from an array of structures.
member.param: A object that determines the color, width of the curve.
Array of structures that represent the points that determine the curve.
member.remarks: The first spline is defined by the first four points in the array. Each additional spline uses the last point as a start and requires an extra three points. The total number of points in the array must be of the form 3 * n + 1 or an exception will be thrown.

member.name: M:C1.C1Flash.FPage.DrawPath(System.Drawing.Pen,System.Drawing.Drawing2D.GraphicsPath)
member.summary: Draws a object.
member.param: object that determines the color, width, and style of the path.
object to draw.

remarks.para: The pen parameter is a regular Pen object, which defines the width, color, and style of the line. The system pens (e.g. Pens.Black, Pens.Red, etc) have a width of one point. If you want to draw thinner or thicker lines, you have to create new Pen objects.

SWF file format has no native support for dashed or dotted line styles. A dashed line can be simulated by breaking up the path into a series of short lines. All lines in SWF file format have rounded joins and end-caps.
The current transformation in the graphic context is applied to the object before it is drawn.

member.name: M:C1.C1Flash.FPage.DrawImage(System.Drawing.Image,System.Drawing.Point)
member.summary: Draws the specified object at the specified location and with the original size.
member.param: object to draw.
structure that represents the location of the upper-left corner of the drawn image.

remarks.para: SWF specification only supports JPEG image files and some of the Bitmap files. C1Flash tries to convert any other images format to the one SWF supports. Currently we support: JPEG, BMP, GIF, TIFF, PNG, ICON and WMF.

If you call DrawImage and pass it a metafile, however, C1Flash Library will play the metafile and convert it into graphics commands instead. This has the advantage of preserving the quality and resolution-independence of the metafile images.
If for some reason you want to render metafiles as regular bitmap images, you should convert the image before calling the DrawImage method.

member.summary: Multiplies the world transformation of this page object and specified the object.

member.name: M:C1.C1Flash.FPage.MultiplyTransform(System.Drawing.Drawing2D.Matrix,System.Drawing.Drawing2D.MatrixOrder)

member.param: 4x4 object that multiplies the world transformation.
Member of the enumeration that determines the order of the multiplication.
member.remarks: A value of MatrixOrder.Prepend for the order parameter specifies that the order of the multiplication is matrix x world transformation. A value of MatrixOrder.Append for order specifies that the order of the multiplication is world transformation x matrix.

member.name: M:C1.C1Flash.FPage.ResetTransform
member.summary: Resets the world transformation matrix of this page object to the identity matrix.
member.remarks: The identity matrix represents a transformation with no scaling, rotation, or translation.

member.name: M:C1.C1Flash.FPage.RotateTransform(System.Single)
member.summary: Applies the specified rotation to the transformation matrix of this page object.
member.param: Angle of rotation in degrees.
member.remarks: The rotation operation consists of multiplying the transformation matrix by a matrix whose elements are derived from the angle parameter. This method applies the rotation by prepending it to the transformation matrix.

member.name: M:C1.C1Flash.FPage.RotateTransform(System.Single,System.Drawing.Drawing2D.MatrixOrder)
member.summary: Applies the specified rotation to the transformation matrix of this page object in the specified order.
member.param: Angle of rotation in degrees.
Member of the enumeration that specifies whether the rotation is appended or prepended to the matrix transformation.
member.remarks: The rotation operation consists of multiplying the transformation matrix by a matrix whose elements are derived from the angle parameter. This method premultiplies (prepends) or postmultiplies (appends) the transformation matrix of the page object by the rotation matrix according to the order parameter.

member.name: M:C1.C1Flash.FPage.ScaleTransform(System.Single,System.Single)

Scale factor in the y direction.
member.remarks: The scaling operation consists of multiplying the transformation matrix by a diagonal matrix whose elements are (sx, sy, 1). This method premultiplies (prepends) the transformation matrix of the page object by the scaling matrix.

member.name: M:C1.C1Flash.FPage.ScaleTransform(System.Single,System.Single,System.Drawing.Drawing2D.MatrixOrder)

Scale factor in the y direction.

member.remarks: The scaling operation consists of multiplying the transformation matrix by a diagonal matrix whose elements are (sx, sy, 1). This method premultiplies (prepends) the transformation matrix of the page object by the scaling matrix.

member.name: T:C1.C1Flash.C1FlashMovie
member.summary: C1FlashMovie is a class (component) that can be used to create multi-frames animation. You are allowed to add/remove/transform graphical objects to the frames.

remarks.para: The coordinate in C1FlashMovie is twip, which is the measurement used by the Macromedia SWF specification. In the SWF format, a twip is 1/20th of a logical pixel. A logical pixel is the same as a screen pixel when the movie is played at 100%that is, without scaling.

member.name: T:C1.C1Flash.C1FlashSlide
member.summary: C1FlashSlide is a class (component) that can be used to create slide show in the Macromedia Flash file format.

remarks.para: Each page of the slide is an FPage class that provides the similar methods to those in the .NET Graphics class.
With the powerful slide designer, user can layout and specify the properties of the UI elements in a convenient way, such as navigation buttons, page header, page footer and page number.
The coordinate in C1FlashSlide is logical pixel.

member.name: T:C1.C1Flash.Base.FSWFStream
member.summary: Class used to store data before it is written to a .swf file

member.name: M:C1.C1Flash.Base.FSWFStream.#ctor
member.summary: Initialize a FSWFStream object.

member.name: M:C1.C1Flash.Base.FSWFStream.WriteBits(System.UInt32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Adds 'size' bits from 'data' to the FSWFStream.
member.remarks: Data is in the form of an unsigned integer. Size indicates how many of the 32 bits are significant and should be output. It checks how many bits are available in the current output byte and works by repeatedly stuffing it with the next bits from 'data' and then adding currentByte to the until all "size" bits have been output.
member.param: Data to write.
Bits of the data to write.

member.name: M:C1.C1Flash.Base.FSWFStream.WriteLargeData(System.Byte[],System.UInt32)
member.summary: Writes large data to the stream.
member.param: Data block in byte array.
Size of the data block.

member.name: M:C1.C1Flash.Base.FSWFStream.FlushBits
member.summary: Kick out the current partially filled byte to the this.
member.remarks: If there is a byte currently being built for addition to the this, then the end of that byte is filled with zeroes and the byte is added to the this.

member.name: M:C1.C1Flash.Base.FSWFStream.WriteDWord(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Writes a 32 bit stream of data to given FSWFStream in reversed byte order.
member.remarks: Data will be written in reserved byte order, so B1B2B3B4 is written as B4B3B2B1. The function does this by sending a byte at a time of the data to the FSWFStream in the appropriate order.
member.param: Data to write.

member.name: M:C1.C1Flash.Base.FSWFStream.WriteWord(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Writes a 16 bit stream of data to the FSWFStream.
member.remarks: The data will be written in reversed order, so B1B2 is written as B2B1.
member.param: The data to write.

member.name: M:C1.C1Flash.Base.FSWFStream.WriteByte(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Writes an 8 bit stream of data to the FSWFStream.
member.remarks: There is no bit swapping!! A byte is written as a byte.
member.param: The data to write.

member.name: M:C1.C1Flash.Base.FSWFStream.GetBuffer
member.summary: Gets the data buffer.
member.returns: Data buffer in byte array.

member.name: M:C1.C1Flash.Base.FSWFStream.Append(C1.C1Flash.Base.FSWFStream)
member.summary: Appends another stream to this stream.
member.remarks: Doesn't actually write the bitmaps, jpegs ... Instead it just writes their file name with a note that the actual file should go there.
member.param: The stream to be appended.

member.name: M:C1.C1Flash.Base.FSWFStream.DumpToFile(System.String)
member.summary: Writes the stream FSWFStream to the given file.
member.param: Name of the SWF file to write.
member.returns: Number of byte written.

member.name: M:C1.C1Flash.Base.FSWFStream.DumpToMemory(System.IO.MemoryStream)
member.summary: Writes the stream to a memory stream.
member.param: The memory stream.
member.returns: Number of byte written.

member.name: M:C1.C1Flash.Base.FSWFStream.MinBits(System.UInt32,System.UInt16)
member.summary: Calculates the minimum number of bits necessary to represent the given number.
member.remarks: The number should be given in its unsigned form with the flag sign equal to 1 if it is signed. Repeatedly compares number to another unsigned int called x. x is initialized to 1. The value of x is shifted left i times until x is greater than number. Now i is equal to the number of bits the UNSIGNED value of number needs. The signed value will need one more bit for the sign so i+1 is returned if the number is signed, and i is returned if the number is unsigned.
member.param: The numbe to be calculated.
1 or 0 to indicates whether the number is a signed value or not.

member.name: M:C1.C1Flash.Base.FSWFStream.MaxNum(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Compares the absolute values of 4 signed integers and returns the unsigned magnitude of the number with the greatest absolute value.
member.param: Number a.
Number b.
Number c.
Number d.
member.returns: The unsigned magnitude of the number with the greatest absolute value.

member.summary: Returns the size of the FSWFStream.

member.name: T:C1.C1Zip.C1ZipEntry
member.summary: Represents an entry in a zip file, and exposes information including the entry name, compressed and uncompressed sizes, date, checksum, etc.

member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.C1ZipEntry.CheckCRC32
member.summary: Calculates a checksum value for the entry and compares it to the checksum that was stored when the entry was created.
member.returns: True if the checksum values match, false otherwise.
member.remarks: This method is used to check the integrity of the entries in the zip file. If the calculated checksum does not match the stored checksum, then either the zip file is corrupted or the program used to create the zip file is incompatible with C1Zip.

member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.C1ZipEntry.CheckPassword
member.summary: Checks whether this can be read with the currently set password.
member.returns: True if the entry can be read with the current password, or if the entry is not encrypted.
member.remarks: This method is more efficient than using a try/catch block and trying to open the entry to determine whether the current password is valid for the entry.

member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.C1ZipEntry.OpenReader
member.summary: Returns a that can be used to read the content of the entry without extracting it to a disk file.
member.returns: A that can be used to read the data in the entry.
member.remarks: The returned is a , which decompresses the data as it is read from the entry.

member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.C1ZipEntry.Extract(System.String)
member.summary: Extracts this entry to a file.
member.param: Name and location of the extracted file.

member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.C1ZipEntry.Remove
member.summary: Removes this entry from the zip file.

member.name: P:C1.C1Zip.C1ZipEntry.FileName
member.summary: Gets the entry name. This is usually a file name, optionally including a path.

member.name: P:C1.C1Zip.C1ZipEntry.SizeUncompressed
member.summary: Gets the original (uncompressed) size of the entry, in bytes.

member.name: P:C1.C1Zip.C1ZipEntry.SizeCompressed
member.summary: Gets the compressed size of the entry, in bytes.

member.name: P:C1.C1Zip.C1ZipEntry.CRC32
member.summary: Gets the checksum calculated when the entry was compressed.
member.remarks: This value can be used to check the integrity of the entry when it is decompressed.

member.name: P:C1.C1Zip.C1ZipEntry.Date
member.summary: Gets the date and time when the file used to create the entry was last modified.
member.remarks: This value can be used to check whether an entry needs to be updated because the source file was modified since it was last compressed.

member.name: P:C1.C1Zip.C1ZipEntry.Comment
member.summary: Gets or sets a comment associated with the entry.

member.name: P:C1.C1Zip.C1ZipEntry.Attributes
member.summary: Gets the file attributes associated with the entry.

member.name: P:C1.C1Zip.C1ZipEntry.IsEncrypted
member.summary: Gets a value that determines whether the entry is encrypted.
member.remarks: Encrypted entries can only be extracted if the property on the containing object is set to the password that was used when the file was added to the zip file.

member.name: T:C1.C1Zip.C1ZipEntryCollection
member.summary: A collection of objects that represent the contents of a zip file.
member.remarks: Use the C1ZipEntryCollection to programmatically manage the contents of zip files. You can add, remove, extract, or insert items into the C1ZipEntryCollection.

member.returns: True if the collection contains an entry with the given name, false otherwise.

member.summary: Determines whether the collection contains an entry.
member.param: Entry of the entry to look for.

member.name: T:C1.C1Zip.C1ZipFile
member.summary: Used for creating, opening, and managing zip files.

remarks.para: Use the or methods to associate the C1Zip file object with a zip file on disk. Then use the property to add, remove, retrieve, or inspect individual entries in the zip file.
can only be used with standard zip files. The component does not support other similar formats such as gzip, zip2, tar, or rar.
The standard zip file imposes some limitations on the size of each entry. You cannot use it to compress files larger than 4 gigabytes (uint.MaxValue).

member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.C1ZipFile.Open(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Opens an existing zip file stored in a stream.
member.param: that contains a zip file.

remarks.para: This method allows you to open and work with a zip file stored in a stream instead of in an actual file.
Typical usage scenarios for this are zip files stored as application resources or in binary database fields.

example.para: The example below loads information from a zip file stored in an embedded resource. To embed a zip file in an application, follow these steps:
1) Right-click the project node in Visual Studio, select the Add | Add Existing Item... menu option.
2) Select a zip file to add to the project as an embedded resource.
3) Select the newly added file and make sure the Build Action property is set to "Embedded Resource".

member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.C1ZipFile.OpenBatch
member.summary: Opens the zip file for multiple operations.

remarks.para: By default, opens and closes the zip file automatically whenever entries are added or removed.

This can cause delays in systems that have certain types of anti-virus software installed, or in situations where you want to add a large number of relatively small entries. In these cases, use the and methods to keep the zip file open until the entire operation is concluded.
Use a finally clause to ensure that the method is called even if an exception occurs.

member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.C1ZipFile.CloseBatch
member.summary: Closes a zip file after it was opened with a call to the method.
member.remarks: See the method for a complete description and a sample.

member.summary: Fired while data is being read from or written into a zip file.
member.remarks: This event is typically used to update the application UI during lengthy operations. It can also be used to cancel the operations.

member.name: P:C1.C1Zip.C1ZipFile.FileName
member.summary: Gets the name of the current zip file.

member.name: P:C1.C1Zip.C1ZipFile.Password
member.summary: Gets or sets the password to use when adding or retrieving entries from the zip file.

remarks.para: If the property is set to a non-empty string, any entries added to the zip file will be encrypted and protected by the password. To extract these entries later, the same password must be used.
The password applies to all entries from the moment it is set. If you set the password to a non-empty string and then add several entries to the zip file, all entries will use the same password.

Although C1Zip supports Unicode characters in passwords, several popular zip utilities do not. To ensure your encrypted zip files can be opened with third-party utilities, use passwords that consist of ASCII characters only.

remarks.para: compresses entries into temporary streams before adding them to the zip file.
Entries with fewer than bytes are compressed using a temporary memory stream.
Entries with more than bytes are compressed using a temporary file. You can control the location of the temporary file using the property.

member.name: P:C1.C1Zip.C1ZipFile.TempFileName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the temporary file to use when adding entries to the zip file.
member.remarks: creates temporary streams while adding entries to a zip file. These temporary streams can be memory-based or disk-based, depending on the size of the entry and on the setting of the property. If a temporary file is used, you can control its location by setting the property. If you don't select a path for the temporary file, will create one automatically using the method.

member.name: T:C1.C1Zip.ZLib.ZStream
member.summary: ZStream is the most flexible and hardest to use class in the C1.C1Zip assembly. It contains a C# implementation of ZLIB's zstream object, which is a general purpose compressor and decompressor.

remarks.para: In most cases, you should be able to use the and classes instead of ZStream. These classes provide friendly and easy-to-use wrappers that hide the ZLIB complexity.

Use ZStream only if you are familiar with ZLIB and need control over the low-level aspects of the data compression or decompression process (e.g., to provide your own buffers or compression dictionaries).

If you choose to use ZStream directly and need technical support, please check out the detailed documentation, sample, and articles available at http://www.info-zip.org/ or http://www.gzip.org/, the official zlib sites.
ZLIB is an open-source, patent-free library created by Jean-Loup Gailly and Mark Adler.

member.remarks: CRC32 checksums are the standard used in zip files. Adler checksums are the default used by ZLIB. Adler checksums are faster to calculate, but are not compatible with the zip format.

member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.ZLib.ZStream.inflateInit
member.summary: Initializes the internal stream state for decompression.
member.returns: Zero on success, an error code on failure.

remarks.para: The fields and must be initialized before by the caller.

inflateInit does not perform any decompression apart from reading the zlib header if present: data decompression is done by the method. Therefore, the next_in and avail_in may be modified, but next_out and avail_out are unchanged.

member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.ZLib.ZStream.inflateInit(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes the internal stream state for decompression.
member.param: Size of the LZ77 sliding compression window in bits (the default value is 15 bits).
member.returns: Zero on success, an error code on failure.

member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.ZLib.ZStream.inflate(System.Int32)
member.summary: Decompresses as much data as possible until the input buffer is exhausted or the output buffer is full.
member.param: How to flush data into the output buffer (default value is 2).
member.returns: Z_OK if some progress has been made (more input processed or more output produced), Z_STREAM_END if the end of the compressed data has been reached and all uncompressed output has been produced, Z_NEED_DICT if a preset dictionary is needed at this point, Z_DATA_ERROR if the input data was corrupted (input stream not conforming to the zlib format or incorrect checksum), Z_STREAM_ERROR if the stream structure was inconsistent (for example if next_in or next_out was null), Z_MEM_ERROR if there was not enough memory, Z_BUF_ERROR if no progress is possible or if there was not enough room in the output buffer when Z_FINISH is used.

remarks.para: inflate performs one or both of the following actions:

1. Decompress more input starting at next_in and update next_in and avail_in accordingly. If not all input can be processed (because there is not enough room in the output buffer), next_in is updated and processing will resume at this point for the next call to inflate.

2. Provide more output starting at next_out and update next_out and avail_out accordingly. inflate provides as much output as possible, until there is no more input data or no more space in the output buffer.

Before the call to inflate, the application should ensure that at least one of the actions is possible, by providing more input and/or consuming more output, and updating the next_* and avail_* values accordingly.
If inflate returns Zero and avail_out == 0, it must be called again after making room in the output buffer because there might be more output pending.
The application can consume the uncompressed output when it wants, for example when the output buffer is full (avail_out == 0), or after each call of inflate.
This method may introduce some output latency (reading input without producing any output) except when forced to flush.

member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.ZLib.ZStream.inflateEnd
member.summary: Frees all dynamically allocated data structures for this stream, discards any unprocessed input, and does not flush any pending output.
member.returns: Zero on success, an error code on failure.

member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.ZLib.ZStream.inflateSync
member.summary: Skips invalid compressed data until a full flush point is found, or until all available input is skipped. No output is provided.
member.returns: Zero on success, an error code on failure.

member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.ZLib.ZStream.inflateSetDictionary(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes the decompression dictionary from the given uncompressed byte sequence.
member.param: Data in the dictionary.
Number of bytes in the dictionary.
member.returns: Zero on success, an error code on failure.

remarks.para: This method must be called immediately after a call of if this call returned Z_NEED_DICT. The dictionary chosen by the compressor can be determined from the Adler32 value returned by this call to inflate.
The compressor and decompressor must use exactly the same dictionary (see the method).

member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.ZLib.ZStream.deflateInit(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes the internal stream state for compression.
member.param: Compression level between zero and nine (0-9).
member.returns: Zero on success, an error code on failure.

remarks.para: Compression level 1 gives best speed, 9 gives best compression.
Compression level zero gives no compression at all (the input data is simply copied a block at a time).
The default compression level is 6, which provides a compromise between speed and compression.

member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.ZLib.ZStream.deflateInit(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes the internal stream state for compression.
member.param: Compression level between zero and nine (0-9).
Size of the LZ77 sliding compression window in bits (the default value is 15 bits).
member.returns: Zero on success, an error code on failure.

remarks.para: Compression level 1 gives best speed, 9 gives best compression.
Compression level zero gives no compression at all (the input data is simply copied a block at a time).
The default compression level is 6, which provides a compromise between speed and compression.

member.name: M:C1.C1Zip.ZLib.ZStream.deflate(System.Int32)
member.summary: Compresses as much data as possible, and stops when the input buffer becomes empty or the output buffer becomes full.
member.param: Non-zero to force some data to be flushed into the output buffer.
member.returns: Zero on success, an error code on failure.

remarks.para: deflate performs one or both of the following actions:

1. Compress more input starting at next_in and update next_in and avail_in accordingly. If not all input can be processed (because there is not enough room in the output buffer), next_in and avail_in are updated and processing will resume at this point for the next call to deflate.

2. Provide more output starting at next_out and update next_out and avail_out accordingly. This action is forced if the parameter is non zero. Forcing flush frequently degrades the compression ratio, so this parameter should be set only when necessary (in interactive applications). Some output may be provided even if flush is not set
This method may introduce some output latency (reading input without producing any output) except when forced to flush.
If deflate returns with avail_out == 0, this method must be called again with the same value of the parameter and more output space until the flush is complete (deflate returns with avail_out != 0).

member.returns: Zero on success, an error code on failure.
